intro: Thysanella robusta, commonly known as the robust thysanella, is a species of flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a feathery appearance. Thysanella robusta is typically found in forest margins and rocky areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
